title: Thurso to Scrabster Walk Route

images.title: Thurso Castle and shore by David Martin, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Thurso Castle and shore. Historically, Thurso has served as a gateway to the Orkney Islands, particularly via the ferry from Scrabster. The town's medieval heritage is highlighted by Old St Peter’s Kirk, dating back to the 12th century, and the remnants of Thurso Castle, which showcase its rich architectural history.

images.title: Thurso Bay by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Thurso Bay

images.title: Coastal path, Thurso by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Coastal path, Thurso

description: This walk from Thurso to Scrabster offers a delightful mix of coastal and urban landscapes. Starting on the waterfront in Thurso, you'll head west to Victoria Walk, a scenic coastal path that provides breathtaking views over the Pentland Firth. On clear days, you can spot the Orkney Islands in the distance. This route then transitions to roadside pavements and coastal paths, making it accessible yet varied. The walk is enriched by the natural beauty of the area. Look out for seabirds like guillemots and fulmars along the cliffs and, in the waters below, seals and occasionally porpoises. The coastal vegetation includes hardy grasses, sea thrift, and heathers, which thrive in the windswept conditions. Upon reaching Scrabster, the working harbour adds a contrasting dynamic to the walk, with fishing boats and ferries creating a bustling atmosphere. The views here extend towards Holborn Head and beyond, making it a rewarding end point for a coastal exploration.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head east along the coast and you could visit Dunnet Head and Duncansby Stacks.

display_address: Esplanade, Fisher Biggins, Thurso, Highland, Alba / Scotland, KW14 8BL, United Kingdom
